alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 17 at 3:18PM AKST until November 18 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM AKST SATURDAY FROM WHITTIER TO TURNAGAIN PASS... * WHAT...Near Whittier, Blizzard conditions expected. West winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile. For Turnagain Pass, blowing snow with visibility reduced to one half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Whitter to Turnagain Pass. * WHEN...Until 11 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero through Turnagain Pass could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...No additional snow is expected during this event. Reduced visibilities will be caused by winds lifting and blowing transportable snow already on the ground.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
